trans-unit.source: Provision an Azure Storage account
trans-unit.target: Provision an Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: Since the simulated device will upload a file in an Azure Storage blob, you must have an Azure Storage account.
trans-unit.target: Since the simulated device will upload a file in an Azure Storage blob, you must have an Azure Storage account.

trans-unit.source: You can use an existing one, or follow the instructions in [About Azure Storage] to create a new one.
trans-unit.target: You can use an existing one, or follow the instructions in [About Azure Storage] to create a new one.

trans-unit.source: Take note of the storage account connection string.
trans-unit.target: Take note of the storage account connection string.

trans-unit.source: Send an Azure blob URI to the simulated device
trans-unit.target: Send an Azure blob URI to the simulated device

trans-unit.source: In this section, you'll modify the **SendCloudtoDevice** console app you created in [Send Cloud-to-Device messages with IoT Hub] to include an Azure blob URI with a shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you'll modify the **SendCloudtoDevice** console app you created in [Send Cloud-to-Device messages with IoT Hub] to include an Azure blob URI with a shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: This allows the cloud back end to grant write access to the blob only to the recipient of the cloud-to-device message.
trans-unit.target: This allows the cloud back end to grant write access to the blob only to the recipient of the cloud-to-device message.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, right-click the **SendCloudtoDevice** project, and then click **Manage NuGet Packages...**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, right-click the **SendCloudtoDevice** project, and then click **Manage NuGet Packages...**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Manage NuGet Packages window.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Manage NuGet Packages window.

trans-unit.source: Search for `WindowsAzure.Storage`, click **Install**, and accept the terms of use.
trans-unit.target: Search for `WindowsAzure.Storage`, click **Install**, and accept the terms of use.

trans-unit.source: This downloads, installs, and adds a reference to the [Microsoft Azure Storage SDK](https://www.nuget.org/packages/WindowsAzure.Storage/).
trans-unit.target: This downloads, installs, and adds a reference to the [Microsoft Azure Storage SDK](https://www.nuget.org/packages/WindowsAzure.Storage/).

trans-unit.source: In the **Program.cs** file, add the following statements at the top of the file:
trans-unit.target: In the **Program.cs** file, add the following statements at the top of the file:

trans-unit.source: In the **Program** class, add the following class fields, substituting the connection string for your storage account.
trans-unit.target: In the **Program** class, add the following class fields, substituting the connection string for your storage account.

trans-unit.source: Then add the following method (you can substitute any blob container name, this tutorial uses **iothubfileuploadtutorial**):
trans-unit.target: Then add the following method (you can substitute any blob container name, this tutorial uses **iothubfileuploadtutorial**):

trans-unit.source: This method creates a new blob reference and generates a shared access signature URI as described in [Create and use a SAS with Blob storage](../storage/storage-dotnet-shared-access-signature-part-2.md).
trans-unit.target: This method creates a new blob reference and generates a shared access signature URI as described in [Create and use a SAS with Blob storage](../storage/storage-dotnet-shared-access-signature-part-2.md).

trans-unit.source: Note that the method above generates a signature URI that is valid for 24 hours.
trans-unit.target: Note that the method above generates a signature URI that is valid for 24 hours.

trans-unit.source: If the target device needs more time to upload the file (e.g. it connects infrequently, it has unreliable connectivity to upload a large file), you might consider longer expiration times for the signatures.
trans-unit.target: If the target device needs more time to upload the file (e.g. it connects infrequently, it has unreliable connectivity to upload a large file), you might consider longer expiration times for the signatures.

trans-unit.source: Modify the **SendCloudToDeviceMessageAsync** in the following way:
trans-unit.target: Modify the **SendCloudToDeviceMessageAsync** in the following way:

trans-unit.source: This method sends a cloud-to-device message that contains two application properties: one identifying this message as a command to upload a file, the other holding the blob URI.
trans-unit.target: This method sends a cloud-to-device message that contains two application properties: one identifying this message as a command to upload a file, the other holding the blob URI.

trans-unit.source: It also requests full delivery acknowledgments.
trans-unit.target: It also requests full delivery acknowledgments.

trans-unit.source: Note that the information in the two application properties can be serialized in a message body, but that would incur additional processing to serialize and deserialize the information.
trans-unit.target: Note that the information in the two application properties can be serialized in a message body, but that would incur additional processing to serialize and deserialize the information.
